Reviews.Title: “Cold days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gerhard T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The central heating was out of order, so the room was extremely cold and I cought a cold. I would recommend this hotel anyway because of the excellent situation in via Sistina, but not in winter! The personnell was very frindly, but when I complained the low temperature in the room I was only promised.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, but TOO old and smelly!”
Reviews.Author: KreyzTravelr
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome and made a reservation for this hotel at the airport. It is conveniently located, at the top of the Spanish steps (There is a lift from the metro station to the top). I expected the hotel to be old as many 3 star hotels in Europe are. This was OLD, the room smelled, the shower was TINY and had mildew. The towels were stained. I'm glad we made a reservation for only one night and that there were no rooms available for the next few nights. I couldn't have stayed there any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff - Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julijuls715
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, safe and comfortable hotel in an absolutely great location. The staff was wonderfully gracious, helpful, professional and friendly. The rooms are quaint, well maintained and quite nice. I cannot understand all of the negative reviews I am seeing. Maybe they were expecting something super fancy? I don't know, but it was fine for me. I don't spend thousands of dollars on a trip to sit around in my hotel room. It was the perfect place to sleep for the night and then spend the day seeing all of the wonderful sites of Rome. Being so close to the Spanish Steps was also helpful for me as far as finding my way around and having a big landmark to find my way back to the hotel. There was a nice selection for breakfast as well. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ascib1854775
Reviews.Content: I do not agree with the very negative reviews below. This hotel was truly reasonable for the price we paid and the location was absolutely perfect (1 minute away from the Spanish Steps/Piazza di Spagna). Do not expect to eat there as it only offers a simple continental breakfast in the morning. It must be said that the bathroom was not perfect, definitely not very clean, but we always had fresh towels and never found it to be a health hazard. Staid in a triple room (double bed + single) with my brother and father and never found reason to complain - Via Sistina doesn't really get noisy at night. In summer, the air conditioning can be a little too loud. However, we were very fluent in Italian which might be a great asset for dealing with the staff, which were friendly and obliging. For those who are not picky about their hotel and who only require it for bedding and washing, this is just fine. Being Italian or fluent in Italian would also benefit you - otherwise try finding a more tourist oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgegeneva
Reviews.Content: Don’t be seduced by this hotel's location (not far from the Spanish Steps). There are numerous hotels of a comparable price in the area that are sure to offer better value for money. We spent 4 dreadful nights in a dusty room that presented to the noisy street beyond. On our first night (Wednesday), the air conditioner dripped heavily onto the old timber floor boards below. We were greeted the following morning with a huge pooling of water across the room. We then requested the air conditioner be fixed, which reception agreed to. We returned in the afternoon to discover the drip had been resolved, but the air conditioner still wasn’t operating. This was unacceptable given the humidity both outside and in). I reported the problem to reception who advised that I could change rooms the following morning, or that the air con unit would again be fixed. The next day we were unable to change rooms due to a ‘full house’. So we had to endure 4 nights in the wretched hot box that was supposed to be a 3 star room. Not ideal when you require a bit of energy to see the many sites of Rome. On the Saturday, we noticed that the hot water wasn’t working. The cold water too was but a trickle. I again reported this to reception. I was initially advised that others in the hotel were probably using the hot water and that I’d have to wait. I did, but to no avail. We were essentially without water both Saturday and Sunday, as were others who at this stage were lining up to complain. Upon departure, I complained about the lack of water and air conditioning. I was met with an obnoxious response from the receptionist who told me she ‘just works there’ and that she is ‘not the manager’. I reminded her that I had to complain to somebody and unfortunately it could only be her. She also said that ‘these things happen’ and that if there were plumbing issues on Friday, there was nothing they could do until Monday. That’s right- this is a ‘hotel’ that expects its guests to go without hot water (and tolerate a dribble from the cold tap) for a weekend, because management is not prepared to pay an after-hours plumbing service to fix what is clearly an urgent problem. I told them that we would enjoy a better service from a youth hostel and that I simply do not understand how the hotel achieved a 3 star rating. The receptionist replied, ‘stars have nothing to do with water’. Well if that’s the case, I’m still at a loss where 2 of their stars came from. If a hotel is rated according to its decor and furnishings, I give this hovel absolutely no stars. Similarly, it deserves no stars for its service, its meagre breakfast, or for its security (we had to leave our bags in a common corridor upon arrival, accessible to all and guarded by nobody). In addition the section of door panel around our lock had been carved away allowing anybody to easily manipulate the lock beyond. I insisted that I wasn’t going to pay the full fee for our stay, which was enormous given the state of the place. The hotel did agree to a tokenistic discount, but the little euro saved hardly made up for the truly disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “We were disgusted and will never be back. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: lkearns
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel, it was apparent that the upkeep was not as shown in pictures. The rugs were thrown about in the hallway, giving a shabby appearance. After getting they key to the room, it was obvious that the room had not been properly cleaned from the previous stay. The bathtub was moldy, and there was used soap left for us to use. In addition, the shower head was loose and ready to fall, posing a safety threat. The sheets were torn in several places. The air conditioning was broken, but we still had to pay for it. One set of sheets had a crusty brown substance with hair stuck to it. There were also old toe nails on the floor. Furthermore, the wall paper was peeling off the wall, and the ceiling was stained black around the air conditioning. When these problems were presented to management, we were informed that there was nothing they could do about our situation and they could not adjust our payment. We said that it was not okay to allow tenants to sleep in dirty sheets, so the manager gave us sheets to change the beds ourself. Absolutely horrible experience. The pictures on the website are deceiving and the hotel is nothing short of disgusting and repulsive. Unbelievably horrid place for the price of 230 euro/ night when we stayed at a nicer place 6 blocks away for 140 euro a night that was a much better deal for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, disgusting hotel, poor management”
Reviews.Author: glogig
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Rome, and my first and last stay at this dump. The only good thing I can say is that its location was good...right near the Spanish Steps. After that, it's all downhill. The wallpaper was pealing off the walls in the hallways and rooms. The hall rugs looked as if they had never been cleaned, and the hallways were filled with cigarette smoke which came from the stair landing where the employees were enjoying their cigarettes. The first room we were given was dismal and overlooked a huge light well. We asked for our room to be changed, and they gave us a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the street. The bathroom was small...you could sit on the "john" and brush your teeth at the same time. The shower was small and covered in mold. (I've traveled to third world countries that had less mold in their bathrooms.) I told the man at the desk the next day and they said they would take care of it. The next day our room smelled like bleach, however, the mold remained. I took a towel, rubbed some of the mold off the wall and brought it to the front desk. I told them they had to scrub the wall to get rid of it. How difficult was this to figure out? The next day the cleaning person made a feeble attempt at scrubbing, but no measurable improvement could be seen. My empirical impression is that management does not have a handle on how its hotel is being run, and there is no oversight by the present employees to ensure that the hotel is being run properly.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible-Mold-False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: Ahrshtace
Reviews.Content: This is a 1/2 star hotel at best. Our room smelled of mold and was not livable. We had to goto another hotel but of course Trinita would give us no refund or cared that we left. Stay away....stay very far away. Location is good by not worth developing a disease caused by the mold. I would not recommend this hotel to my enemies.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch: no relationship to pictures!”
Reviews.Author: tt4
Reviews.Content: This place is dreary and ultimately dis-honest given the actual state of this "hotel" vs. the website pictures. I would classify it as sub-par pensione. One room had questionable odor, other room had serious mold on ceiling, bathroom had no soap. One room (quiet!) opened to airshaft with abandoned toilets and other trash littering the base. Staff couldn't have been nicer; but we still had to pay for a night even though we did not stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at any cost”
Reviews.Author: investor314
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel www.hoteltrinitadeimontihotel.com through the Greek Travel Agency Manessis www.manessistravel.gr. from Oct.2-5, 2009. We were told that this is a "better" category 3 hotel in Rome in a cenral location. The centrality was the only true fact about the hotel. The air-conditioner did not work and the room overlooked a court filled with trash and a couple of old used toilet bowls. They moved us to another room, room 206, on the second floor, with a narrow bath tub. The tub floor was curved so that both my wife and I fell twice, fortunately with no accident. The air-conditioning did not work there either, but the weather got cooler so we did not need it. However the street noise was unbearable so we had to sleep with the windows completely shut. The plug in the bathroom was non-functional, the TV controller had a battery missing and the telephone worked erratically. We had booked a room with twin beds, but they gave us a double bed and a cot instead. And the pictures on their website are totally misleading. The view is not that of the Spanish steps but of a narrow noisy street, Via Sistina. In other words, it ruined our vacation. To add insult to injury, Manessis charged us more than 200 euro per night for this hotel, when comparable hotels - as we found out later - listed for about 120 euro per night. In conclusion Avoid Manessis and this hotel, and, if you can, make your own online reservations. This Greek travel agency was very disappointing and provided ver little help. They could not even provide a rudimentary map of Rome, but gave us instead an almost unreadable xerox copy of their map.

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to book on the net or fax and get a reply.”
Reviews.Author: palinure
Reviews.Content: When we left after the second night, the "technician" still had not fixed their connection and they were still insisting we use a bank machine to bring "cash"! Naturally we declined to accept a policy absent from their internet site, and documented our experience to guard against improper debiting of our credit card.

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: myraom
Reviews.Content: room ok 3 sharing 3 beds requested and recieved. room was cold but very quiet so slept like babies!! desk staff very helpful with planning our day, also gave us good advice on where to eat. dinning room staff also very friendly. location was excellent, near the metro and also central enough to walk everywhere!! would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location=Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: roma08
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Trinitia dei Monti itself I must admit cannot compete or be compared with some of the hotels I have stayed at in my life. But one must remember when traveling in Europe, that EVERYTHING there is very old. You can't be expecting beautiful, brand new, amazing hotels for this price, because you will be extremely disappointed. Me and my friends found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. They gave us good tips for restaurants etc. One night we spent half an hour talking to the woman working at the front desk about good pizza places, she even phoned about 3 different restaurants to ask if they would deliver it for us. The breakfast was not anything special, but we made our own creations with what we were given that ended up being a hit with everyone in our group. If you are on a tight budget, a good idea is to find a "supermarket" (you'll find them much different than the ones in north america, especially size wise) and buy snacks, veggies, fruit etc for those long tours and day trips, so you arent constantly having to buy food at cafes and eat out. What I loved most about this hotel, and I think many people will agree with me on this, is the amazing location. It is literally 2 mintues away from the beautiful Spanish steps (also where a metro station is conveniently located, making it very easy to get to almost anywhere in Rome) and if you have lots of money to spend, one of the most famous shopping districts in the world, the Via dei Condotti. I cannot remember if all of the rooms faced the Via Sistina (the street the hotel is located on), but our room did, and we never wanted to shut the window. I loved just listening to the sounds of the city, the vespas, cars, people talking etc..Rome is a very large city, one should expect it to be noisy. The view from the window was amazing too, looking down the narrow street as far as you could see. I personally loved Rome more than anywhere else I visited in Italy. This hotel was great because of its good price and amazing location. I would highly recommend this hotel to families, young people traveling etc.. I would not recommend it to couples looking for a romantic getaway, honeymoons, or people who have high standards and are willing to spend a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Fine”
Reviews.Author: ZoeBan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location, right by the Spanish Steps. The desk attendants were nice and helpful. The room was fine, but dimly lit, the bathroom was clean. The furniture, not including the bed, was old but half-expected to be so, and it was quiet. Our room was on the same level as the front desk, one flight up. Breakfast was one of the less satisfactory ones, compared to other hotels we stayed at. The coffee you get automatically given is instant coffee, so you have to specify that you want "real" coffee made with the espresso machine. If you don't like lemon zest flavored croissants filled with sweet stuff, you are out of luck, the alternative is enormous buns or cereal. Yogurt saves the day. But this is mostly the case with breakfast in other hotels with a few exceptions.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: amezagt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights on the last leg of our Italian vacation (Venice, Florence and Rome). Of the three cities, this was the worst hotel we stayed at. When we arrived we used the lift to go up to the concierge. The lift was extremely small and smelled of urine. When we got into the room, it was dimly lit, and reminded me of a shady motel. When we went to use the toilet, we found that it had previously been used, and not flushed!! We were competely disgusted and didn't feel comfortable or confident that the rest of the room had been cleaned. We immediately asked the concierge for a new room, and they claimed the hotel was fully booked. Breakfast in the morning was again, the poorest of the three hotels we stayed at, and consisted of croissants, and and bread, fruit cocktail, and two types of cereals. The coffee tasted like dirty water, and the cappucino's were lukewarm. We also asked the concierge for advise on restaurants, best times to visit certain museums etc...and were not given any helpful advice. This was a STARK contrast to our hotels in Florence and Venice, (of similar price/and star ratings) where the concierge's bent over backwards recommending and reserving dinners, and even got us book-ahead tickets for the various museums so we wouldn't have to wait in line. The one great thing about this hotel is location. Located right on top of the Spanish Steps, which is near a Metro station, it was incredibly easy to get to and from during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service”
Reviews.Author: qowi
Reviews.Content: The rooms were ok, but the service was quite appalling. The concierge was downright rude and made our holiday much less enjoyable, as we had to put up with his haughty attitude and rude expression every time we passed him. Breakfast was terrible too and when we asked them to book a taxi they booked a so-called limo, which consisted of a private car with a mafioso-like man driving at extremely high speed, who threatened us when we asked him to slow down. In short, the hotel experience made our holiday considerably worse and we recommend you stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel beds I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Jlake108
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok but the beds were terrible. My husband and I do have occasional back problems but we had no problems with the beds in the other five hotels we stayed in while visiting Italy but these beds were horrendous. Even the teenagers who were with us complained about the beds. And the staff said they were new beds - how do you buy new beds that are lumpy and very hard? Other than that, the hotel was ok. A bit run down and the air conditioner in my son's room did not work but they did move him to another with a moderately working air conditioner. Breakfast was soso - rather stale bread and not much selection. The location was excellent only a block or so from the Spanish Steps which was a fun place to hang out. The staff were friendly and helpful. If it weren't for the beds, I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Shauny_A
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews on this hotel prior to travelling we requested and got a room at the back of the hotel where we had been advised that it would be quiet and it was! Our room was clean, tidy and large. But the decor could have done with sprucing up a little bit. The breakfast consisted of tea/coffee, cereal, crossiants/bread rolls with a selection of spreads. Fairly typical of hotels in Italy, we have stayed else where in Italy with more to select from but it is normal in Italy to not receive a cooked breakfast. Overall it was OK but but pricey by UK rates at E170 per night (we've stayed in better hotels in London for E130-140 per night). It seems that accomodation in Rome is quite expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Good location -adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: peggypatch
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and for the money the hotel is absolutely fair. The staff were friendly & breakfast although basic, was perfectly adequate. We booked a double and a triple, but there was a mix up on the double so for the first night we had two singles, not a problem for us as our trip was a girls only trip, but had I been there with my husband I would not have been happy at all! Still they rectified the situation the next day. The triple was a lovely huge room. Everything was clean and in working order. The rooms in the front were noisy, but that is to be expected considering the location. All in all I would recommend the hotel, so long as you are aware that you are paying for the location as the accomodation is more like 2 star than 3.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Caution - Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: TXCAWorldTravelers
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation through Orbitz for a 3-night stay at this hotel for February 2005. I had to cancel becuase of a scheduling conflict and when I called Orbitz, they couldn't get it cancelled for me. Orbitz tried over and over again to cancel it but the hotel wouldn't allow it. Instead of cancelling the reservation, the hotel charged my credit card the full amount of the stay even though I cancelled more than a month before my arrival. The folks at Orbitz have been great in trying to put some pressure on the hotel but it's still being worked out. In short, I'd be very careful about booking a room at this hotel. If you decide to, I'd recommend a paper copy of the reservation with clear cancellation information.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Karl60
Reviews.Content: Four night stop. Excellent location (if you don't mind climbing the Spanish Steps some 200 metres away) for the top shops, good restaurants etc. Good location for walking to the main tourist attractions. Felt very safe in the Spanish Steps area at night. Helpful hotel staff who spoke good English. Very basic Continental breakfast inclusive in cost. Overall, a basic 3-star hotel that met expectations in terms of quality, cleanliness and cost but which benefited from a very good location (if you don't mind the Steps). As always, it's a case of managing expectations for a 3-star hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Mold fest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Rome. We stayed at this hotel for five days. Upon arriving, we immediately noticed mold all over the ceilings in the bathroom, and the air conditioner constantly made loud noises that kept us up all night. We were SO disappointed. Our hotels in Florence and Venice were great. That morning we asked to switch rooms. The staff was accomodating, but the second room (although bigger and better) still had mold in the corner. We looked into switching hotels but there was nothing available. This definitely put a damper on our trip. Finally, I wouldn't recommend staying at the top of the Spanish steps. At least twice a day we walked up and down the spanish steps (100 stairs), which can become tiring. Bottom line: Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome and we used Trip advisor to pick this hotel and were not disappointed. The hotel does not look great from the outside but our room was really clean - well decorated and shower was excellent. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast - although the same each day - was also a perfect start to the day. The top of the Spanish Steps was about 150m away and it is an ideal location to walk around this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: debbiesam
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Ideal location, really pleasant staff. The rooms were good, very clean, clean towels etc each day. Breakfast is typical continental, the coffee was wonderful. We stayed in a front facing room, so did have some traffic noise but nothing exceptional. Would stay here a again without hestitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a lovely area. The location is ideal even though it did mean having to lift a buggy with a tired child up the Spanish Steps on a return from a day's sightseeing. Rooms are adequate and tastefully furnished. Those in the front are noisier than those facing the rather glum courtyard. In both rooms air conditioning worked fine and you could keep the window closed and the noise down. Breakfast was fine with coffee, rolls and croissants and some jams and cheese. Overall, nice, clean, pleasant and ideally located --what more could you want from your budget hotel? We would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for One!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a single traveler, this hotel was ideal! The price was good, location excellent, staff helpful, & rooms extremely clean & sanitary. I did not see any of the other rooms, but this one was perfect for me for the price. Had a small closet, 2 night stands with drawers, a desk, chair, small TV & double bed. Nice sized bathroom & sink with plenty of hot water. The only drawback was the small shower-- I had to turn sideways to get in & I am skinny!! But this was a small inconvenience for the price & location. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Rome from Florence and Venice, we were slated to stay at the Hotel ELite (see my other review) for 7 nights. For reasons explained in that review, we checked out after 1 night and started searching for another place. Right around the corner was the Trinita dei Monte. The rate seemed good (15 euros lower than our other option), and the location is perfect (2 minute walk from the top of the Spanish Steps; 5-8 minutes to the Trevi Fountain; 25 minutes to the Colloseum). The room was typical of most 3 star european hotels, small, but comfortable, nicely appointed, good climate control, decent bathroom, and double paned windows for light and noise control. Very courteous staff, decent breakfast. The only weird thing about this hotel was that we stayed on the 2nd floor, but had to go up to the third floor to drop off our key everytime we left. Dropping off your key is typical of Italian hotels, but there was a bit of extra work involved. Nevertheless, it was a small price to pay for a nice hotel!!! When we return to Rome (unless we win the lottery and can stay in a 5 star) we will stay at the Trinita dei Monte again !!!

Reviews.Title: “So-So Stay”
Reviews.Author: CamilleLongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location--down the block from The Hassler and The Intercontinental. It was clean and the staff were pretty helpful, depending on who was at the desk. They did arrange for a van from the airport when we arrived for 80 Euros for a group of 6 and the driver waited an hour and 40 minutes for us because of a delay. The breakfast was adequate and the breakfast area was okay, but nothing to write home about. There is really no lobby, other than the breakfast area behind the desk. The a/c was a disaster in 2 of our family's 3 rooms--working, but clunking away to little effect in one room. Street noise was also a problem sometimes. Don't know if we could have done better for 180 Euros a night in Rome. (They did reduce the rate to 140 Euros a night when we complained that 1 room was too small.)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and family stayed at this hotel during 3 days in late July and found the hotel and its staff to be a pleasent surprise. While not fancy, a three star rating is deserved as the staff were very accomidating, the room very clean & spacious, and the location excellent (i.e. 1 minute from the Spanish Steps). I believe this hotel to be a very good value for the price and would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Trinita Dei Monti
